title: ISic000383. Funerary inscription for Vipsanius Atticus
body:
Facsimile Images

D(is) · M(anibus) · s(acrum)
Vipsanius ·
Atticus ·
vivos · sibi ·
5et · suis

Apparatus criticus

Text frmo autopsy

English translation

Sacred to the spirits of the underworld. Vispanius Atticus (set this up) while living for himself and his family

Italian translation

Consacrato agli Dei Mani. Vispanius Atticus (lo costruì) mentre era in vita per se stesso e la sua famiglia

commentary

The formula vivus sibi et suis is common, reflecting the fact that Vipsanius set up a family funerary monument. The name Vipsanius is common in Catania, and it is likely that these are descendants of freedmen of Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa, the right-hand man of Octavian, who gained property in Sicily after his victory over Sextus Pompeius in 36 BC. The form vivos, instead of the normal vivus, is more common in earlier Latin.

bibliography

  • 10.7101 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 145 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • Manganaro 1988 50 and tav.19.29 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001427
  • Manganaro 1989 171 no.37 fig.40 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001831
